message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.CE 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with the capacity region of the Gaussian Interference Channel (G-IC) and proposes a new approach called Treating Interference as Noise without Time Sharing (TINnoTS) to achieve the closure of the capacity region. This is a core topic in information theory. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the G-IC, which is a fundamental model in wireless communication networks. The proposed approach TINnoTS can be applied to various types of channels, including asynchronous channels, which are relevant to networking and internet architecture. 
3. cs.SI (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a new approach to deal with interference in communication systems, which is a key challenge in systems and control. The proposed approach can be applied to various types of channels and is shown to be optimal in all parameter regimes. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper proposes to use mixed inputs as channel inputs, which is a technique commonly used in multimedia communication systems. The mixed input is the sum of a discrete and a Gaussian random variable, which can be used to improve the performance of the communication system.
